intro: Calyptranthes johnstonii, commonly known as Johnston's calyptranthes, is a small evergreen shrub native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white, fragrant flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments on the windward sides of mountains. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
